intro: Alloispermum tridacoides, commonly known as the Tridacna-like sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Indo-Pacific. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant thrives in saline and brackish water environments, often found in mangrove areas or along tidal flats. Its root system is adapted to withstand fluctuating water levels and salinity. Alloispermum tridacoides plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
